page.title: 18Changes in Pinvin
page.content: We went around Pinvin asking people how long they had lived in the area. Most people hadn't lived there for more than 14 years, but one elderly woman had spent 70 years living in Pinvin. We asked them what changes they had noticed during their time. People said that more private houses had been built, the middle school was a recent addition, new roads had been laid and old ones repaired. An estate of elderly peoples' bungalows had been built in the last 15 years. Some of the elderly villagers had been born in Pinvin and attended the old First school from the age of five until they were fourteen. In those days there was no Middle or High school to go onto. We are lucky today because our education seems to be much better.
